comments:
While running the unit tests locally I'm seeing stack traces like this.  The model in question is not from a file so no base location exists (the cause of the assertion failure).  The problem is though that the catalog functions do not require a base location nor can they enforce that one will always be given to them.  The affected code mentions that the URIResolver API requires a non-null value (bug 117424), but that ignores the fact that one of the argument for a public ID is unrelated to locations.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.xml.core 4 4 2007-10-12 11:57:40.765
!MESSAGE null
!STACK 0

Created an attachment (id=80378)
patch to remove assertion
Valentin, please let me know if this change is alright with you.
Looks OK, the URI resolver appears to gracefully handle a null base location.
